intro: Lycium schweinfurthii var. schweinfurthii, commonly known as the desert nightshade, is a shrub native to arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and has woody stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by red, fleshy berries that ripen in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly serrated edge. The species is adapted to harsh, dry environments and is often found in rocky soils and desert margins.
